question: How ya doin'?
Ahh 3 years this August. If ya lookin for work you might wanna try Aberdeen, that's the closest mill work you're gonna find around here.
Nah just simple economics. Y'know we have a really nice casino here, the wild cherry. You wanna make some money maybe you wanna go on down there and try your luck at the blackjack tables.
answer: Nah I don't think so. Thanks.

question: You're Chris Vaughn? Well hell, I know all about you Chris. I know your folks, I'm sheriff Stan Watkins.
Ralston get outta the car, you're lookin at a real soldier here pay some respect.
Here Chris, We'll give ya a ride up to your folks.
I insist.
Hey it's my pleasure.
I won't take no for an answer . HEY! Get in the car. Did I scare ya with that one?
Ya. Let's go. You were gone a while huh?
answer: 8 years. Harstad was sheriff back then.

question: Harstad, yeah. Sad story. About 5 months back he fell asleep at the wheel and uhhh... hit a tree. Good man, good man and a good sheriff.
Can I help you? Lil' brother.. You come over here and gimme a hug. You look great.
Hey, I couldn't let you be the only one looking good in uniform. Hey ma! Chris is here!
Look at you!
How long do we have ya for?
Really? You're not kiddin.
Ok it rained. Happy?
answer: No. Why dontcha crash on the floor? Ok, I'll crash on the floor, you crash on the bed.

question: uh uh.
Did you really kill people?
Ray Ray! Ahaaa.
How ya doin?
What is that?
Girls actually get in there? How ya been?
Wanna beer?
answer: No. Believe it or not I quit drinkin. I'll take a soda though.

question: Here.
Whoah. .
answer: Ya like that? When you left town it gave me the idea that I should do something with my life too so uhh I went down to Seattle, got a guitar and became all about music. And then pretty soon I was about music and drugs, n pretty soon I was basically just about drugs. Ended up doin 2 years for B+E.

question: I'm sorry.
answer: Nahh, look at me now though right? I been clean and sober for 14 months, doing construction and renewing those supportive and healthy friendships from my past. Matter of fact I talked to the bastards, told em you were back and they asked me to politely remind you that kick off's in twenty minutes.

question: Playin ball?
When did that happen?
answer: His parents hadn't left him the mill more than 2 minutes before he shut it down.

question: Why?
Still got a gut huh Jay?
answer: Still got your reflexes. What, you get tired of being all that you can be?

question: I'm still all I can be.
answer: Really? I'll just have to see about that. What brings you home?

question: I just wanna relax, catch my breath.
You got it. On the first hut!
answer: Ok Vaughn, last chance. That's game!

question: That's cool man.
Good to be back.
answer: See ya round. Hey, if you're not doing anythin later on you could come by the casino. I'll introduce ya to some nice girls, drinks are on me. Whaddya say?

question: See ya tonight.
Heyyy, the dream team!

Yeah well. Welcome to my world. Look tonight, all the drinks are on the house. If you need a line of credit, say how much. And if you need a lil female companionship... done. Alright? Have a good time.
Lookin' for a 6.
answer: Jimmy. Don't roll. Gimme the dice.

question: Lookin' for a 6. Ohhhhh.
answer: You're good, but I saw it.

question: Saw what?
Hey this is a clean game asshole.
Yea.
answer: Let's see about that. Bet you I'll roll a seven.

question: It's not your roll sir. SIR! It's not your roll. Call security.
answer: Put your bets down on the pass line. These dice are comin up seven.

question: No, we gonna let it ride Jimmy. The dice are comin up seven.
Why don't you just take care of that bet and we're even.
answer: Well I would but it wasn't a legitimate bet, you're not the shooter. It's not your ROLL sir.

question: I'm gonna need a statement from him Doctor. I'll also need a copy of your write-up along with toxicoloy, blood alcohol level and so on.
answer: What are you talkin about Stan?

question: I'm just tryin to get some facts here.
answer: Oh come on you need to be out arresting whoever tried to kill my brother not testing his BLOOD.

question: Thank you, they're for my best friend. Hey sarge, so much for our VIP... status. Don't they teach you any fighting skills in the army.
Not good. But I tell you, that guy was feelin me this morning. You okay?
Changed the plugs a while back.
I might've had serious issues with your career choice but just didn't seem fair to take it out on an innocent truck. Where you headin?
answer: I was goin into town to get some supplies. Wanna come?

question: Let's go. Ya whole life, all you wanted to do was get outta here. What made you come back.
answer: You gonna think I'm crazy. I been thinking about the mill. When I was a kid goin to visit you at work, the smell of that fresh-cut cedar. You remember that smell.

question: Mmm I remember a lotta nice things before the mill closed.
answer: When did they go outta business? .

question: Closed about six months ago. There's a home depot about fifteen minutes up the road.
Hey. First of all I wanna say thanks.
He's been fired, and his gaming permit's been pulled. I don't know how my security cameras didn't catch that.
answer: They miss a lot at your place don't they Jay.

question: Look Chris I hate seein ya like this.

Wait wait... so they got a little rough, they were a bit edgy. Understandably. You don't know what kind of assholes they have to put up with on a daily basis. Look, they've been reprimanded. They say you went nuts man. I'm sorry. I know the proper term vets use is post traumatic stress.
answer: What the fuck are you talking about?

question: Whatever it was, you tore my place apart and it wasn't easy for me to get my guys agree not to press charges. Look Chris, if you had a problem... shouldn't you have come to me? Look, I wanna bring you inside. Chris I wanna make you head of security. Whaddya say?

Ah well. I guess you probably need time to think about it. This is for you. It's a little something to help you get... Y'know.. Come on man, don't be like that. I came all the way out here to your house just to see you get back on your feet.
I'm sorry you feel that way. I'll see ya round Chris.
Excuse me. Excuse me.
answer: Well hey Chris. Good to see you up and about, you're lookin spiffy.

question: I'm here to press charges.
answer: Well this isn't about that incident at the casino a while back is it?

question: Yea, it is.
Did you look into it?
answer: They did an internal investigation. That's good enough for me.

question: An internal investigation.
answer: Chris, I know you're familiar with the term 'no fly zone'. Hmm? Cause that's what the casino is. Since the mill closed down that casino is the main source of revenue in this town. So, case closed basically. I'll see ya.

question: I'm not gonna let this stand.
answer: Excuse me? What did you say to me?

question: I said I'm not gonna let this stand.
answer: You're lucky to be alive right now, that's all you need to be concentrating on. This is my town ok, I'm the sheriff here. I'll tell you what will stand, not the other way around. Now please get out of my building.

question: Hey.
This belongs to you.
answer: I appreciate that, I thought this was history.

question: Hi Mrs Vaughn.
answer: Can I talk to you outside for a second. Mom I'll be right back.

question: How you been?
Talked to the sheriff yet?
answer: Well I went down to the police station and I talked to somebody with a badge. Sure as hell didn't seem like much of a sheriff.

question: He's up for re-election you know. Maybe you could take his job.
answer: Somebody ought to. How about you?

question: Sunshine and pine trees. Been readin these books, teach you how to cultivate happiness. Books on the future, go with the flow, that sorta thing.
I have my moments.
Yep. Been there almost a year.
Lot better than it treated you.
answer: I like that. Jay Hamilton's done well for himself hasn't he.

question: Yea, he's a real go-getter that one.
answer: Must be. I heard he got you.

question: Lasted about 8 minutes, a long long time ago.
answer: You still work for him though.

question: Rent's gotta be paid Chris.
Hope to see you around.
answer: Do you? Thanks for the jacket.

question: Mr Crow, you may present your client's case.
answer: You're fired. Your honor, I'd like to plead my own case.

question: Order, order. Mr Vaughn, if you choose to represent yourself and not be represented by legal counsel you realise that you can't then claim a mistrial on that basis.
Very well Mr Vaughn.
answer: I don't deny anything that was said here today.

question: Does that mean you're changing your plea to guilty?
answer: I'm not guilty of anything. Except standing up for myself when the law wouldn't.

question: Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.
answer: I grew up in this town. People used to walk tall in this town, they wouldn't have traded the mill for a crooked casino.

question: Mr Vaughn we're not here to listen to civic speeches.
answer: And they wouldn't have stood around while drugs were being sold to kids.

question: Sustained. Mr Vaughn you're close to being held in contempt.
answer: I was justified in what I did, and if you acquit me of these charges I'm gonna run for sheriff. And if elected, I'm gonna fix this town.

question: Order, order. Mr Vaughn you are now charged with contempt.
answer: And I will make sure that THIS never happens to anyone again without punishing those who did it.

question: I order the jury to ignore what they have just seen. Mr Vaughn take your seat. Order! Order! Mr Forman, has the jury reached a verdict? Will the defendant please rise.
answer: This is mine. Watkins. You're all fired.

question: Hey Chris.
You're joking right?
What's the problem sheriff?
answer: You. And the drugs you're pedalling out of your casino.

question: Oh. Only thing that's going on in my casino right now is reconstruction. You took care of that.
answer: Yea that's right and I plan on taking care of everything else too.

question: If you can, try to think this through. A casino is a license to print money. Why would I jeopardise that by selling drugs?
answer: Cause you owned the town Jay. It's changed now.

question: Really? See the only thing that I think has changed around here is that every morning you get to wake up and put on that nifty lil badge. But underneath that badge is the same guy that couldn't make it playing college football, apparently couldn't make it in the army and not gonna make it as a cop.
Yea, and if you push too hard you're gonna be a man who doesn't live to see 40. License please. Thanks sheriff.
answer: Sir get your tail lights fixed, it's your last warning.

question: What's wrong with my tail lights?
They're broken.
Mornin deputy.
answer: No, nope, no. Come on man you know I hate cops. You been sheriff 2 minutes and I'm already startin to hate you. I'm a convicted felon.

question: I got a lil pull around here.
answer: Oh now you're a CROOKED cop doing favours for friends. That's how it starts. See next thing you know you'll be taking bribes, setting up roadblocks, frisking dudes crotches.

question: Are you done? Ray I need your help.
I need you to take me to drugs school.
answer: I get to wear a uniform?

question: Why does it always have to be your fight?
No. I put my guns down a long time ago.
You and me both boy. Chris, listen. You be careful.
Please step away from the vehicle. Now Mr Booth are you still upset over that body cavity search? WOOOOOOOO! I forgot, you got no vehicle. Please disperse, there is nothing to s...
Yeah.
Sure.
answer: I'm gonna stay with him tonight. I need you to take care of my parent's place.

question: You think they're gonna take it that far? I'm with you man, I'll check in later.
Kay.
Hey
answer: Hi. How's the food around here? Brought you special treats. Salmon, Fried Chicken, Potato Salad. You got cups?

question: Don't you have to work tonight?
answer: Hmm I quit. I figured you know, you were making some changes around here, I could make a few myself.

question: You gonna be ok?
Get up Jay.
answer: Just a sec. Remember we used to play hide n seek up here? That was my favourite sound.

question: Get up!
answer: Look... Chris... just... You wanna know what my new favourite sound's gonna be? The sound of you screaming like a little bitch.
